column1: Zinc is a metal as well as an essential mineral.

The person may receive: - Activated charcoal - Airway support, including oxygen, breathing tube through the mouth (intubation),and ventilator (breathing machine) - Blood and urine tests - Chest x-ray - CT (computerized tomography, or advanced imaging) scan - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Fluids through the vein (intravenous or IV) - Laxative In serious cases medicines, called chelators, which remove zinc from the bloodstream may be needed, and the person may need to be hospitalized.
